I’ve gone through this problem twice. Once I solved it but I didn’t know how.

Today I finally found the reason. Turns out that the `/usr/share/gazebo-9/media` folder was not inside the `gzweb/http/client/assets` folder.

After manually copying `cp -R /usr/share/gazebo-9/media gzweb/http/client/assets/`it worked.

Just to make sure, I removed the `media` folder from `gzweb/http/client/assets`and reloaded gzweb again, and the colors didn't load. Copied again `media` to `gzweb/http/client/assets` and there the colors were.

### Extra info

The `media` folder is already automatically copied by [get\_local\_models.py](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/4b4191169c2c636e66feda42cf734795123b5c66/get_local_models.py#lines-52) when called by [deploy.sh](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/4b4191169c2c636e66feda42cf734795123b5c66/deploy.sh#lines-145), but for that the [GAZEBO\_RESOURCE\_PATH](#!/osrf/gzweb/src/4b4191169c2c636e66feda42cf734795123b5c66/get_local_models.py#lines-59) variable need to be correctly set. In any case, just copying the `media` manually as showed above solves the problem :sunglasses:
